hadiths.english_translation: Not a hadith - biographical entry: The name of Abu Fakhta is Said ibn Alaqah. Abu Nu'aim gave him his kunya. He narrates from Ibn Umar, Ibn al-Zubayr, and his father. Al-Thawri and Isra'il narrated from him, and Ibn Uyaynah was suspicious of him. The freed slave of Umm Hani bint Abi Talib al-Hashimi. Musa said to us: Hammad narrated to us from Hijaj from Thuwayr, the freed slave of Ju'dah ibn Hubayyrah. Ummayyad Ju'dah was al-Makhzumi. Abu Safwan al-Thaqafi said: I heard Sufyan al-Thawri saying: Thuwayr was one of the pillars of lying. Yahya and Ibn Mahdi would not narrate from him.

potential_issues.issue: This entry is not a complete hadith but rather extensive biographical information about a narrator
potential_issues.impact: Cannot be analyzed as a hadith transmission; this is editorial biographical commentary

potential_issues.issue: Contains explicit criticism of Thuwayr: Al-Thawri said he was 'one of the pillars of lying' (من أركان الكذب) and major scholars refused to narrate from him
potential_issues.impact: If this narrator appears in any hadith chain, it would make that hadith problematic

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abu Hurayrah: Some people asked us: What about what the sea casts up? He said: Eat it. Marwan sent the same to Zayd. Also reported: We asked Abu Hurayrah about what the sea has thrown up, and he said: Eat it. If some people from the Hijaz came and asked Marwan, he said: Go to Zayd and Abu Hurayrah and ask them. Also reported: People from al-Jar asked Marwan, the governor of Madinah, and he sent the message to Zayd and Abu Hurayrah regarding the same matter.

hadiths.english_translation: Not a hadith - biographical entry: Ja'far ibn Abi Talib, Abu Abdullah al-Hashimi. He was killed during the lifetime of the Prophet ﷺ. He emigrated to Abyssinia, then emigrated to Madinah and was killed on the day of Mu'tah. Ja'far ibn Ibrahim, from the descendants of Dhu al-Janahayn, from the descendants of Abdullah ibn Ja'far ibn Abi Talib al-Hashimi al-Hijazi.

potential_issues.issue: This entry is not a complete hadith but rather biographical information about a companion
potential_issues.impact: Cannot be analyzed as a hadith transmission; this is editorial content

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ali ibn Husain: He saw a man who came to an opening near the grave of the Messenger of Allah ﷺ and entered it and supplicated. So he called him and said: Shall I not inform you of a hadith I heard from my father, from my grandfather, from the Prophet ﷺ, who said: Do not take my grave as a festival.

hadiths.english_translation: Not a hadith - biographical/editorial entry: Ja'far ibn Bard al-Khaza (al-Khazzaz). He is counted among the Basrians. He heard from Umm Salim bint Malik. He heard A'isha saying: Stick to this miswak stick, so clean your teeth with it. Nasr ibn Ali reported from Ja'far al-Khazza, and he was reliable, heard from Ibn Sireen regarding dreams, and from the Prophet ﷺ: "There is blessing in milk." Yazid ibn Harun heard from him. Zayd ibn al-Hubab al-Rasbi said: Ishhaq narrated to me, who said: Harmi ibn Amara narrated to us: Ja'far ibn Bard al-Dabbagh narrated to us. Ja'far ibn Burqan al-Jazri, Abu Abdullah. He heard from Maymun ibn Mahan and al-Zuhri. Al-Thawri and Wakee' narrated from him. He came to Kufa. It is said: al-Kalabi. He died in the year 154. It is said: He was illiterate.

potential_issues.issue: This entry is not a complete hadith but rather extensive biographical information about multiple narrators
potential_issues.impact: Cannot be analyzed as a hadith transmission; this is editorial biographical content

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Abbas ibn Abd al-Muttalib: The Prophet ﷺ forbade branding (marking) on the face, so he branded (instead) on the flanks (sides).

hadiths.english_translation: Narrated by Ibn Abbas: Gabriel came to me and ordered me to announce the talbiyyah (the pilgrim's prayer).
